event.title: passed the Indian Removal Act in 1830

data.event: The United States Congress passed the Indian Removal Act in 1830, and forced most of the Southeastern tribes to Indian Territory during the following decade.

event.title: forced most of the Southeastern tribes to Indian Territory during the following decade

data.event: The United States Congress passed the Indian Removal Act in 1830, and forced most of the Southeastern tribes to Indian Territory during the following decade.
Greenville was founded in 1824 by William W. Blanton, who filed for land from the United States government.
This plot now constitutes most of downtown Greenville.
Greenville became the county seat in 1844.
